sen.j: 大谷本廟（おおたにほんびょう）は、京都府京都市東山区にある浄土真宗の宗祖親鸞の墓。
sen.e: Otani mausoleum is a graveyard in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture where the grave of Shinran, the founder of the Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) is located.
Otani mausoleum is a graveyard in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture where the grave of Shinran, the founder of the Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) is located.
Otani mausoleum is a graveyard in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture where the grave of Shinran, the founder of the Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) is located.

sen.j: 通称・西大谷。
sen.e: It is commonly known as Nishi Otani.
It is commonly known as Nishi Otani.
It is commonly known as Nishi Otani.

sen.j: （同じ京都市東山区内に、真宗大谷派（東本願寺）が宗祖親鸞の墓所としている大谷祖廟（東大谷）があるため）
sen.e: (It is known as so because of the Otani Sobyo grave [Higashi Otani] which is said by Shinshu sect Otani school [Higashi Hongan-ji Temple] to be the graveyard of the founder Shinran.)
sen.cmt: original欄の原文の冒頭及び文中の括弧を区別するため、文中の括弧を”[...]”にて示しました。 原文「・・ため」→「・・ため、そのように知られている」と訳出しました。（文の形を整えるため、前列を受けた形にしました。）
sen.e: (It is known because of the Otani Sobyo grave [Higashi Otani] which is said by the Shinshu sect Otani school [Higashi Hongan-ji Temple] to be the graveyard of the founder Shinran.)
(It is known because of the Otani Sobyo grave [Higashi Otani] which is said by the Shinshu sect Otani school [Higashi Hongan-ji Temple] to be the graveyard of the founder Shinran.)

sen.j: 1272年（文永9年）に東山大谷の地に建立された親鸞の祖廟、大谷廟堂（のちの本願寺）に由来する。
sen.e: It originates from the Otani-byodo Mausoleum (later became Hongan-ji Temple), which was built as the mausoleum of Shinran in Otani, Higashiyama Ward in 1272.
It originated from the Otani-byodo Mausoleum (later became Hongan-ji Temple), which was built as the mausoleum of Shinran in Otani, Higashiyama Ward in 1272.
It originated from the Otani-byodo Mausoleum (later became Hongan-ji Temple), which was built as the mausoleum of Shinran in Otani, Higashiyama Ward in 1272.

sen.j: 西本願寺第十二世の准如時代の1603年（慶長8年）に江戸幕府は知恩院の造営に際して、大谷本願寺跡地の代替地として現在地を与えた。
sen.e: Upon extension of buildings in Chion-in Temple in 1603 during the period of the twelfth chief priest Junnyo in West Hongan-ji Temple, the Edo Shogunate provided the site where Otani Mausoleum is located now as an alternative to the site where Otani Hongan-ji Temple had been built. The new place is adjacent to "odabisho (crematorium for Shinran)" which is said to have been Ennin-ji Temple in the southern part of Toribeno where the founder Shinran was cremated.
sen.cmt: 御荼毘所（読み「おだびしょ」出典myoman.blog5.fc2.com/category2-1.html） 1文４０文字以上にて２文に分けました。 原文「鳥部野（とりべの）の南の辺：定訳不明 原文「知恩院の造営」→後述に従い、「知恩院の拡張造営」として訳出しました。
sen.e: Upon the extension of the buildings in the Chion-in Temple in 1603 during the period of the twelfth chief priest Junnyo in West Hongan-ji Temple, the Edo Shogunate provided the site where Otani Mausoleum is located now as an alternative to the site where Otani Hongan-ji Temple had been built. The new place is adjacent to "odabisho" (crematorium for Shinran) which is said to have been the Ennin-ji Temple in the southern part of Toribeno where the founder Shinran was cremated.

Upon the extension of the buildings in the Chion-in Temple in 1603 during the period of the twelfth chief priest Junnyo in West Hongan-ji Temple, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) provided the site where Otani Mausoleum is located now as an alternative to the site where Otani Hongan-ji Temple had been built.
sen.cmt: 用語統一一原文一訳文の例外対処原文修正

sen.j: 宗祖親鸞が荼毘に付された「鳥部野（とりべの）の南の辺、延仁寺」と伝わる「御荼毘所」に隣接する現在地を与えた。
sen.e: The new place is adjacent to 'odabisho' (crematorium for Shinran) which is said to have been the Ennin-ji Temple in the southern part of Toribeno where the founder Shinran was cremated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処"→'

sen.j: （「御荼毘所」は、大谷本廟の飛び地境内となっている。
sen.e: (The "odabisho (crematorium for Shinran)" is in the precinct at the detached estate of the Otani mausoleum.)
sen.cmt: original原文は括弧”（”にて始まるも、文末の括弧”）”はセル内にみられず、１行下のセルにありますが、訳文では、文末にも括弧を付与しました。
sen.e: (The "odabisho (crematorium for Shinran)" is in the precinct at the detached estate of the Otani mausoleum.)
(The 'odabisho' (crematorium for Shinran) is in the precinct at the detached estate of the Otani mausoleum.)

sen.j: 境内の御廟や、浄土真宗本願寺派門信徒による多くの墓碑が建ち並ぶ大谷墓地や無量寿堂（納骨所）には墓参の信徒が絶えない。
sen.e: Buddhist supporters continually visit the Mausoleum in the precinct, Otani Cemetery in which gravestones stand in rows for the followers of Jodo Shinshu Hongan-ji school, and Muryojudo (cinerarium).
sen.cmt: 門信徒→門徒として訳出しました（参照http://home.if-n.ne.jp/~saikyoji/monto/monto.html） 門徒→followers (英辞郎on the web http://eow.alc.co.jp/%e9%96%80%e5%be%92/UTF-8/)
sen.e: Buddhist supporters continually visit the Mausoleum in the precinct, Otani Cemetery in which gravestones stand in rows for the followers of Jodo Shinshu Hongan-ji school, and Muryojudo (cinerarium).
Buddhist supporters continually visit the Mausoleum in the precinct, Otani Cemetery in which gravestones stand in rows for the followers of Jodo Shinshu Hongan-ji school, and Muryojudo (cinerarium).

sen.j: 1272年（文永9年） 親鸞の祖廟、大谷廟堂（のちの本願寺）建立。
sen.e: Otani-byodo Mausoleum (later became Hongan-ji Temple) was built as the mausoleum of Shinran in 1272.
Otani-byodo Mausoleum (later became Hongan-ji Temple) was built as the mausoleum of Shinran in 1272.
Otani-byodo Mausoleum (later became Hongan-ji Temple) was built as the mausoleum of Shinran in 1272.

sen.j: （本願寺の歴史の詳細は本願寺の歴史の項目を参照）
sen.e: (The details of the history of Hongan-ji Temple can be referred to on the page of the History of Hongan-ji Temple.)
(The details of the history of Hongan-ji Temple can be referred to on the page of the History about Hongan-ji Temple.)
(The details of the history of Hongan-ji Temple can be referred to on the page of the History about Hongan-ji Temple.)

sen.j: 1465年（寛正6年） 延暦寺西塔の衆徒らによって大谷本願寺破却される。
sen.e: Otani Hongan-ji Temple was destroyed by the monk-soldiers of the Enryaku-ji Temple Saito, West Tower in 1465.
Otani Hongan-ji Temple was destroyed by the monk-soldiers of the Enryaku-ji Temple Saito, West Tower in 1465.
Otani Hongan-ji Temple was destroyed by the monk-soldiers of the Enryaku-ji Temple Saito, West Tower in 1465.

sen.j: 破却後は井上願知なる人物によって祖墳が守護され、大谷道場と称した。
sen.e: After the temple was destroyed, the original grave was kept safe by the person called Ganchi Inoue and was called Otani Dojo.
sen.cmt: 井上願知→後述の欄を参照し、"Ganchi Inoue"と記載しました。 祖墳→"the original grave" (墳＝土を高く盛った墓場[岩波国語辞典]より、類推しました。) 守護する→keep safe (PDIC 5.0.15)
sen.e: After the temple was destroyed, the original grave was kept safe by a person called Ganchi Inoue and was called Otani Dojo.
After the temple was destroyed, the original grave was kept safe by a person called Ganchi INOUE and was called Otani Dojo.

sen.j: 1532年（天文 (日本)元年） 山科本願寺破却（天文の錯乱）、大谷道場も破却される。
sen.e: When Yamashina Hongan-ji Temple was destroyed at the Tenbun War in 1532, Otani Dojo was also destroyed.
When Yamashina Hongan-ji Temple was destroyed in the Tenbun War in 1532, the Otani Dojo was also destroyed.
When Yamashina Hongan-ji Temple was destroyed in the Tenbun War in 1532, the Otani Dojo was also destroyed.

sen.j: 願知の子孫・祐願によって復興。
sen.e: It was restored by Yugan, a descendant of Ganchi Inoue.
sen.cmt: 願知→先述をうけて、"Ganchi Inoue"としました。 祐願→読み不明（やむをえずYuganと充ててあります）
sen.e: It was restored by Yugan, a descendant of Ganchi Inoue.
It was restored by Yugan, a descendant of Ganchi Inoue.

sen.j: 1571年（元亀2年） 石山合戦に際し、大谷道場破却される。
sen.e: Otani Dojo was destroyed again at the Ishiyama War in 1571.
sen.cmt: 大谷道場破却される→大谷道場再び破却される と訳出しました（先述をうけて）
sen.e: Otani Dojo was destroyed again during the Ishiyama War in 1571.
Otani Dojo was destroyed again during the Ishiyama War in 1571.

sen.j: 1589年（天正17年） 祐願の妻・妙祐と子息・祐誓、大谷道場の復興にあたって豊臣秀吉から地銭免除の朱印状を受ける。
sen.e: For restoration of Otani Dojo, Myoyu and Yusei, who were the wife and son of Yugan, respectively, received Shuinjo (shogunate license to trade) for "jishisen menjo (exemption of tax on land)" from Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in 1589.
sen.cmt: 原文「祐誓」→Yusei (読み不明。読みを、祐誓寺を参照して充てました：http://www.inochikirakira.com/kirakira2a/frm_int_tpl.html） 原文「地銭免除」→定訳不明、読み不明。原文を「地子銭免除」と読み、Jishisen (よみdictionary.goo.ne.jp/leaf/jn/82749/m0u/じし/）
sen.e: For restoration of the Otani Dojo, Myoyu and Yusei, who were the wife and son of Yugan, respectively, received Shuinjo (shogunate license to trade) for "jishisen menjo (exempt of land tax)" from Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in 1589.

For restoration of the Otani Dojo, Myoyu and Yusei, who were the wife and son of Yugan, respectively, received Shuinjo (shogunate license to trade) for jishisen menjo (exempt of land tax) from Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in 1589.

sen.j: 1603年（慶長8年） 知恩院拡張造営に際し、祐誓の妹婿の善了の申し出により、親鸞荼毘の延仁寺の旧地と伝えられる鳥部山に代替地を拝領する。
sen.e: Upon extension of buildings in Chion-in Temple in 1603, according to the proposal by Zenryo, the husband of Yusei's younger sister, the new place was given within the area of Mt. Toribe, where Ennin-ji Temple, in which the founder Shinran was cremated, is said to have been located.
sen.cmt: 原文「善了」→読み不明"Zenryo"と充てました。
sen.e: Upon extending the buildings in Chion-in Temple in 1603, according to the proposal by Zenryo, the husband of Yusei's younger sister, the new place that was given was within the area of Mt. Toribe, where Ennin-ji Temple, in which the founder Shinran was cremated, is said to have been located.

Upon extending the buildings in Chion-in Temple in 1603, according to the proposal by Zenryo, the husband of Yusei's younger sister, the new place that was given was within the area of Mt. Toribe, where Ennin-ji Temple, in which the founder Shinran was cremated, is said to have been located.

sen.j: 大谷道場の御堂は、知恩院造営に先立って1600年（慶長5年）に教如の命によって祐誓が四条富小路に移した。
sen.e: Yusei moved the mi-do Hall (enshrinement hall) of Otani Dojo to Shijo Tomi-koji Street by the order of Kyonyo in 1600 prior to the extension of buildings in Chion-in Temple.
sen.cmt: 原文「移し、徳勝寺（現・徳正寺。→１文４０文字以上にて、「移し、」で文を分け、「徳勝寺」からは、直後のセルにて訳出しました。
sen.e: Yusei moved the mi-do Hall (enshrinement hall) of Otani Dojo to Shijo Tomi-koji Street by orders of Kyonyo in 1600 prior to extending the buildings in Chion-in Temple.
Yusei moved the mi-do Hall (enshrinement hall) of Otani Dojo to Shijo Tomi-koji Street by orders of Kyonyo in 1600 prior to extending the buildings in Chion-in Temple.

sen.j: 徳勝寺（現・徳正寺。真宗大谷派寺院）を創建した。
sen.e: Then he founded Tokushoji (Present Tokushoji with different Chinese characters, a temple for Shinshu sect Otani school).
sen.cmt: 原文「移し、徳勝寺（現・徳正寺。→「徳勝寺」の読み不明、Tokushojiと充て、「（現・徳正寺」について、Present Tokushoji with different Chinese charactersと説明を付与しました。
sen.e: Then he founded Tokushoji (Present Tokushoji with different Chinese characters, a temple for Shinshu sect Otani school).
Then he founded Tokusho-ji Temple (Present Tokushoji with different Chinese characters, a temple for Shinshu sect Otani school).

sen.j: 鳥部山の寺地拝領後、善了は大谷道場を改めて勝久寺を創建した。
sen.e: After the alternate site was provided within the area of Mt. Toribe, Zenryo founded Shokyu-ji Temple by building Otani Dojo anew.
After the alternate site was provided within the area of Mt. Toribe, Zenryo founded Shokyu-ji Temple by building Otani Dojo anew.
After the alternate site was provided within the area of Mt. Toribe, Zenryo founded Shokyu-ji Temple by building Otani Dojo anew.

sen.j: 旧地には知恩院塔頭崇泰院が建立されたが、知恩院作事奉行の一人、勝誉道清によって祖墳遺跡が残されることになった。
sen.e: In the site where it was located previously, Sotaiin, a minor temple for Chion-in Temple, was erected; however, the remains of the original grave were preserved by Dosei SHOYO, one of the bugyo (magistrates) for Sakuji (construction) of Chion-in Temple.
sen.cmt: 原文「勝誉道清」→読み不明、Dosei SHOYO と充てました。（勝誉智教（しょうよ ちきょう）を参考にwww.geocities.jp/j_houzenji/1annai.html）
sen.e: In the site where it was located previously, Sotaiin, a minor temple for Chion-in Temple, was erected; however, the remains of the original grave were preserved by Dosei SHOYO, one of the bugyo (magistrates) for Sakuji (construction) of Chion-in Temple.

In the site where it was located previously, Sotaiin, a minor temple for Chion-in Temple, was erected; however, the remains of the original grave were preserved by Dosei SHOYO, one of the bugyo (magistrates) for Sakuji (construction) of Chion-in Temple.

sen.j: 1639年（寛永16年） 勝久寺、西本願寺に属する。
sen.e: Shokyu-ji Temple was placed under the umbrella of West Hongan-ji Temple.
Shokyu-ji Temple was placed under the umbrella of West Hongan-ji Temple.
Shokyu-ji Temple was placed under the umbrella of West Hongan-ji Temple in 1639.

sen.j: その後、勝久寺は西本願寺の親鸞廟所として整備され、大谷本廟（西大谷）となる。
sen.e: Thereafter, Shokyu-ji Temple was maintained as the mausoleum of Shinran for West Hongan-ji Temple and came to be called Otani mausoleum (Nishi-Otani).
Thereafter, Shokyu-ji Temple was maintained as the mausoleum of Shinran for West Hongan-ji Temple and came to be called Otani mausoleum (Nishi-Otani).
Thereafter, Shokyu-ji Temple was maintained as the mausoleum of Shinran for West Hongan-ji Temple and came to be called Otani mausoleum (Nishi-Otani).

sen.j: 京都府京都市東山区五条橋東六丁目514番地
sen.e: 6-514 Gojohashi-higashi, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture
6-514 Gojohashi-higashi, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture
6-514 Gojohashi-higashi, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture

sen.j: 京阪本線五条駅 (京阪)から徒歩10分
sen.e: It is ten-minute walk from Keihan Main Line Gojo-station (Keihan).
It is a ten-minute walk from Keihan Main Line Gojo-station (Keihan).
It is a ten-minute walk from Keihan Main Line Gojo Station (Keihan).

sen.j: 京都市バス、京阪バス五条坂バス停下車すぐ
sen.e: It is close to Gojozaka bus stop of both Kyoto Municipal and Keihan Buses.
It is close to Gojozaka bus stop of both Kyoto Municipal and Keihan Buses.
It is close to Gojozaka bus stop of both Kyoto Municipal and Keihan Buses.

sen.j: 清水寺
sen.e: Kiyomizudera Temple
Kiyomizudera Temple
Kiyomizu-dera Temple

sen.j: 建仁寺
sen.e: Kennin-ji Temple
Kennin-ji Temple
Kennin-ji Temple
